counterfeit.translation[0].definitions[0: made to look exactly like something else, in order to deceive people
counterfeit.translation[1].definitions[0: to copy something exactly in order to deceive people
counterfeit.translation[2].definitions[0: made to look exactly like something, usually illegally
Last year about $80 million in counterfeit notes were seized, compared with $77 billion in genuine notes produced.
the growing trade in counterfeit goods
counterfeit.translation[3].definitions[0: to copy something so that it looks like something else, usually illegally
We must mark coins in a way that makes them harder to counterfeit.
